src: Upon my life, I am a lord indeed And not a tinker nor Christophero Sly. Well, bring our lady hither to our sight; And once again, a pot o' the smallest ale.
trg: Will't please your mightiness to wash your hands? O, how we joy to see your wit restored! O, that once more you knew but what you are! These fifteen years you have been in a dream;

src: here I clip The anvil of my sword, and do contest As hotly and as nobly with thy love As ever in ambitious strength I did Contend against thy valour. Know thou first, I loved the maid I married;
trg: never man Sigh'd truer breath; but that I see thee here, Thou noble thing! more dances my rapt heart Than when I first my wedded mistress saw Bestride my threshold. Why, thou Mars!

src: Come I too late?
trg: Ay, if you come not in the blood of others, But mantled in your own.

src: I know so.
trg: Thou art the cause, and most accursed effect.

src: No longer shall you gaze on't, lest your fancy May think anon it moves.
trg: Let be, let be. Would I were dead, but that, methinks, already-- What was he that did make it? See, my lord, Would you not deem it breathed? and that those veins Did verily bear blood?

src: nor was't much, Thou wouldst have poison'd good Camillo's honour, To have him kill a king: poor trespasses, More monstrous standing by:
trg: whereof I reckon The casting forth to crows thy baby-daughter To be or none or little; though a devil Would have shed water out of fire ere done't: this is not, no, Laid to thy answer:

src: And shall I have?
trg: You shall.

src: What's here? one dead, or drunk? See, doth he breathe?
trg: He breathes, my lord. Were he not warm'd with ale, This were a bed but cold to sleep so soundly.

src: If you do fight against your country's foes, Your country's fat shall pay your pains the hire; If you do fight in safeguard of your wives, Your wives shall welcome home the conquerors;
trg: If you do free your children from the sword, Your children's children quit it in your age. Then, in the name of God and all these rights, Advance your standards, draw your willing swords.

src: It is so, sir: truly, I have forgot you.
trg: I am a Roman; and my services are, as you are, against 'em: know you me yet?

src: Ay; or else 'twere hard luck, being in so preposterous estate as we are.
trg: I humbly beseech you, sir, to pardon me all the faults I have committed to your worship and to give me your good report to the prince my master.

src: Long live Gonzalo!
trg: And,--do you mark me, sir?

src: Marry, we were sent for to the justices.
trg: And so was I: I'll bear you company.
I like it well that our fair queen and mistress Smiles at her news, while Warwick frowns at his.

src: already he hath carried Notice to Escalus and Angelo, Who do prepare to meet him at the gates, There to give up their power.
trg: If you can, pace your wisdom In that good path that I would wish it go, And you shall have your bosom on this wretch, Grace of the duke, revenges to your heart, And general honour.

src: How! I inform them!
trg: You are like to do such business.

src: Yet one word more: grief boundeth where it falls, Not with the empty hollowness, but weight: I take my leave before I have begun, For sorrow ends not when it seemeth done.
trg: Commend me to thy brother, Edmund York. Lo, this is all:--nay, yet depart not so; Though this be all, do not so quickly go; I shall remember more. Bid him--ah, what?

src: No, marry; I fear thee!
trg: Let us take the law of our sides; let them begin.

src: This is a creature, Would she begin a sect, might quench the zeal Of all professors else, make proselytes Of who she but bid follow.
trg: How! not women?

src: I would speak with Clarence, and I came hither on my legs.
trg: Yea, are you so brief?

src: Why, what of that?
trg: If it be possible for you to displace it with your little finger, there is some hope the ladies of Rome, especially his mother, may prevail with him. But I say there is no hope in't:

src: I will not seal your knowledge with showing them. I will make much of your voices, and so trouble you no further.
trg: The gods give you joy, sir, heartily!

src: Besides, you know, it draws something near to the speech we had to such a purpose.
trg: But, most of all, agreeing with the proclamation.

src: We have been called so of many; not that our heads are some brown, some black, some auburn, some bald, but that our wits are so diversely coloured:
trg: and truly I think if all our wits were to issue out of one skull, they would fly east, west, north, south, and their consent of one direct way should be at once to all the points o' the compass.

src: Remember our reward, when the deed is done.
trg: 'Zounds, he dies: I had forgot the reward.

src: Have with you.
trg: Come, come, they are almost here. How many stand for consulships?

src: In troth, I think she would. Fare you well, then. Come, good sweet lady. Prithee, Virgilia, turn thy solemness out o' door. and go along with us.
trg: No, at a word, madam; indeed, I must not. I wish you much mirth.

src: The gates made fast! Brother, I like not this; For many men that stumble at the threshold Are well foretold that danger lurks within.
trg: Tush, man, abodements must not now affright us: By fair or foul means we must enter in, For hither will our friends repair to us.

src: Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham. The mayor towards Guildhall hies him in all post: There, at your meet'st advantage of the time, Infer the bastardy of Edward's children:
trg: Tell them how Edward put to death a citizen, Only for saying he would make his son Heir to the crown; meaning indeed his house, Which, by the sign thereof was termed so.

src: Then, Clifford, were thy heart as hard as steel, As thou hast shown it flinty by thy deeds, I come to pierce it, or to give thee mine.
trg: Then strike up drums: God and Saint George for us!

src: And must we be divided? must we part?
trg: Ay, hand from hand, my love, and heart from heart.

src: O unbid spite! is sportful Edward come? Where slept our scouts, or how are they seduced, That we could hear no news of his repair?
trg: Now, Warwick, wilt thou ope the city gates, Speak gentle words and humbly bend thy knee, Call Edward king and at his hands beg mercy? And he shall pardon thee these outrages.

src: Here comes the lady: O, so light a foot Will ne'er wear out the everlasting flint: A lover may bestride the gossamer That idles in the wanton summer air, And yet not fall; so light is vanity.
trg: Good even to my ghostly confessor.

src: Shall I obtain it?
trg: Name it, fair cousin.

src: Neither.
trg: Thou hast sworn my love to be.

src: And what of him, Tranio?
trg: If he be credulous and trust my tale, I'll make him glad to seem Vincentio, And give assurance to Baptista Minola, As if he were the right Vincentio Take in your love, and then let me alone.

src: Then plainly know my heart's dear love is set On the fair daughter of rich Capulet: As mine on hers, so hers is set on mine; And all combined, save what thou must combine By holy marriage:
trg: when and where and how We met, we woo'd and made exchange of vow, I'll tell thee as we pass; but this I pray, That thou consent to marry us to-day.

src: You will not own it.
trg: More than mistress of Which comes to me in name of fault, I must not At all acknowledge. Now, for conspiracy, I know not how it tastes; though it be dish'd For me to try how:

src: O, sir, his lackey, for all the world caparisoned like the horse; with a linen stock on one leg and a kersey boot-hose on the other, gartered with a red and blue list;
trg: an old hat and 'the humour of forty fancies' pricked in't for a feather: a monster, a very monster in apparel, and not like a Christian footboy or a gentleman's lackey.

src: And may not young men die, as well as old?
trg: Well, gentlemen, I am thus resolved: on Sunday next you know My daughter Katharina is to be married: Now, on the Sunday following, shall Bianca Be bride to you, if you this assurance;

src: that's for my country: He that has but effected his good will Hath overta'en mine act.
trg: You shall not be The grave of your deserving; Rome must know The value of her own: 'twere a concealment Worse than a theft, no less than a traducement, To hide your doings;

src: I hear some noise. Lady, come from that nest Of death, contagion, and unnatural sleep: A greater power than we can contradict Hath thwarted our intents. Come, come away.
trg: Thy husband in thy bosom there lies dead; And Paris too. Come, I'll dispose of thee Among a sisterhood of holy nuns: Stay not to question, for the watch is coming;

src: to grace him only That thought he could do more, a very little I have yielded to: fresh embassies and suits, Nor from the state nor private friends, hereafter Will I lend ear to. Ha!
trg: what shout is this? Shall I be tempted to infringe my vow In the same time 'tis made? I will not. My wife comes foremost;

src: Hidest thou that forehead with a golden crown, Where should be graven, if that right were right, The slaughter of the prince that owed that crown, And the dire death of my two sons and brothers?
trg: Tell me, thou villain slave, where are my children?

src: make them of no more voice Than dogs that are as often beat for barking As therefore kept to do so.
trg: Let them assemble, And on a safer judgment all revoke Your ignorant election; enforce his pride, And his old hate unto you;

src: How now! what mean'st thou, that thou help'st me not? By heavens, the duke shall know how slack thou art!
trg: I would he knew that I had saved his brother! Take thou the fee, and tell him what I say; For I repent me that the duke is slain.

src: O, find him! give this ring to my true knight, And bid him come to take his last farewell.
trg: Romeo, come forth; come forth, thou fearful man: Affliction is enamour'd of thy parts, And thou art wedded to calamity.

src: Gremio, 'tis known my father hath no less Than three great argosies; besides two galliases, And twelve tight galleys: these I will assure her, And twice as much, whate'er thou offer'st next.
trg: Nay, I have offer'd all, I have no more; And she can have no more than all I have: If you like me, she shall have me and mine.

src: Will the time serve to tell? I do not think. Where is the enemy? are you lords o' the field? If not, why cease you till you are so?
trg: Marcius, We have at disadvantage fought and did Retire to win our purpose.

src: to the love I have in doing good a remedy presents itself. I do make myself believe that you may most uprighteously do a poor wronged lady a merited benefit; redeem your brother from the angry law;
trg: do no stain to your own gracious person; and much please the absent duke, if peradventure he shall ever return to have hearing of this business.

src: Welcome, sweet prince, to London, to your chamber.
trg: Welcome, dear cousin, my thoughts' sovereign The weary way hath made you melancholy.

src: First, the gods bless you for your tidings; next, Accept my thankfulness.
trg: Sir, we have all Great cause to give great thanks.

src: They are worn, lord consul, so, That we shall hardly in our ages see Their banners wave again.
trg: Saw you Aufidius?

src: Marry, sir, 'tis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers: therefore he that cannot lick his fingers goes not with me.
trg: Go, be gone. We shall be much unfurnished for this time. What, is my daughter gone to Friar Laurence?

src: Tranio, since for the great desire I had To see fair Padua, nursery of arts, I am arrived for fruitful Lombardy, The pleasant garden of great Italy;
trg: Pisa renown'd for grave citizens Gave me my being and my father first, A merchant of great traffic through the world, Vincetino come of Bentivolii.

src: Out upon him! prig, for my life, prig: he haunts wakes, fairs and bear-baitings.
trg: Very true, sir; he, sir, he; that's the rogue that put me into this apparel.

src: two braver men Ne'er spurr'd their coursers at the trumpet's sound;
trg: With them, the two brave bears, Warwick and Montague, That in their chains fetter'd the kingly lion And made the forest tremble when they roar'd.

src: and, but that frailty hath examples for his falling, I should wonder at Angelo. How will you do to content this substitute, and to save your brother?
trg: I am now going to resolve him: I had rather my brother die by the law than my son should be unlawfully born. But, O, how much is the good duke deceived in Angelo!

src: And we his subjects sworn in all allegiance Will apprehend you as his enemy.
trg: But did you never swear, and break an oath?

src: All souls that will be safe fly from my side, For time hath set a blot upon my pride.
trg: Comfort, my liege; remember who you are.

src: The urging of that word 'judgment' hath bred a kind of remorse in me.
trg: What, art thou afraid?

src: When will he be here?
trg: When he stands where I am and sees you there.

src: Then at my lodging, an it like you: There doth my father lie; and there, this night, We'll pass the business privately and well. Send for your daughter by your servant here:
trg: My boy shall fetch the scrivener presently. The worst is this, that, at so slender warning, You are like to have a thin and slender pittance.

src: O deadly sin! O rude unthankfulness! Thy fault our law calls death; but the kind prince, Taking thy part, hath rush'd aside the law, And turn'd that black word death to banishment:
trg: This is dear mercy, and thou seest it not.

src: My lord, the mayor of London comes to greet you.
trg: God bless your grace with health and happy days!

src: The base is right; 'tis the base knave that jars. How fiery and forward our pedant is! Now, for my life, the knave doth court my love: Pedascule, I'll watch you better yet.
trg: In time I may believe, yet I mistrust.

src: Why, what a peevish fool was that of Crete, That taught his son the office of a fowl! An yet, for all his wings, the fool was drown'd.
trg: I, Daedalus; my poor boy, Icarus; Thy father, Minos, that denied our course;

src: Men judge by the complexion of the sky The state and inclination of the day: So may you by my dull and heavy eye, My tongue hath but a heavier tale to say.
trg: I play the torturer, by small and small To lengthen out the worst that must be spoken:

src: See, they have shut him in.
trg: To the pot, I warrant him.

src: Fear not our care, sir.
trg: Hence, and shut your gates upon's. Our guider, come; to the Roman camp conduct us.

src: E'en at hand, alighted by this; and therefore be not--Cock's passion, silence! I hear my master.
trg: Where be these knaves? What, no man at door To hold my stirrup nor to take my horse! Where is Nathaniel, Gregory, Philip?

src: Stand, and go back.
trg: You guard like men; 'tis well: but, by your leave, I am an officer of state, and come To speak with Coriolanus.

src: Doubly divorced! Bad men, you violate A twofold marriage, 'twixt my crown and me, And then betwixt me and my married wife. Let me unkiss the oath 'twixt thee and me;
trg: And yet not so, for with a kiss 'twas made. Part us, Northumberland; I toward the north, Where shivering cold and sickness pines the clime; My wife to France:

src: Such is the lightness of you common men. But do not break your oaths; for of that sin My mild entreaty shall not make you guilty. Go where you will, the king shall be commanded;
trg: And be you kings, command, and I'll obey.

src: The ditty does remember my drown'd father. This is no mortal business, nor no sound That the earth owes. I hear it now above me.
trg: The fringed curtains of thine eye advance And say what thou seest yond.

src: Suppose they take offence without a cause, They are but Lewis and Warwick: I am Edward, Your king and Warwick's, and must have my will.
trg: And shall have your will, because our king: Yet hasty marriage seldom proveth well.

src: Tell me, thou villain slave, where are my children?
trg: Thou toad, thou toad, where is thy brother Clarence? And little Ned Plantagenet, his son?

src: How could that be? Either thou art most ignorant by age, Or thou wert born a fool. now from the oracle They will bring all; whose spiritual counsel had, Shall stop or spur me. Have I done well?
trg: Well done, my lord.

src: He's poor in no one fault, but stored with all.
trg: Especially in pride.

src: My lord: he doth entreat your grace; To visit him to-morrow or next day: He is within, with two right reverend fathers, Divinely bent to meditation;
trg: And no worldly suit would he be moved, To draw him from his holy exercise.

src: 'Tis better said than done, my gracious lord: I am a subject fit to jest withal, But far unfit to be a sovereign.
trg: Sweet widow, by my state I swear to thee I speak no more than what my soul intends; And that is, to enjoy thee for my love.

src: they shall know we have strong arms too.
trg: Why, masters, my good friends, mine honest neighbours, Will you undo yourselves?

src: Our doubts are traitors And make us lose the good we oft might win By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo, And let him learn to know, when maidens sue, Men give like gods;
trg: but when they weep and kneel, All their petitions are as freely theirs As they themselves would owe them.

src: This is strange now: do you two know how you are censured here in the city, I mean of us o' the right-hand file? do you?
trg: Why, how are we censured?

src: No, pray thee. I must obey: his art is of such power, It would control my dam's god, Setebos, and make a vassal of him.
trg: So, slave; hence! Come unto these yellow sands, And then take hands: Courtsied when you have and kiss'd The wild waves whist, Foot it featly here and there; And, sweet sprites, the burthen bear.

src: It may not be.
trg: Let me entreat you.

src: And too soon marr'd are those so early made. The earth hath swallow'd all my hopes but she, She is the hopeful lady of my earth:
trg: But woo her, gentle Paris, get her heart, My will to her consent is but a part; An she agree, within her scope of choice Lies my consent and fair according voice.

src: Master, a mercatante, or a pedant, I know not what; but format in apparel, In gait and countenance surely like a father.
trg: And what of him, Tranio?

src: Off with his son George's head!
trg: My lord, the enemy is past the marsh After the battle let George Stanley die.

src: Well, sir, what answer made the belly?
trg: Sir, I shall tell you. even so most fitly As you malign our senators for that They are not such as you.

src: Get you hence, for I must go Where it fits not you to know.
trg: Whither?

src: Why then, by God--
trg: God's wrong is most of all. If thou hadst fear'd to break an oath by Him, The unity the king thy brother made Had not been broken, nor my brother slain: What canst thou swear by now?

src: And so we will, provided that he win her.
trg: I would I were as sure of a good dinner.

src: Thou hadst, and more, Miranda. But how is it That this lives in thy mind? What seest thou else In the dark backward and abysm of time?
trg: If thou remember'st aught ere thou camest here, How thou camest here thou mayst.

src: Mine, such as fill my heart with unhoped joys.
trg: Mine, full of sorrow and heart's discontent.

src: Marry, they say my uncle grew so fast That he could gnaw a crust at two hours old 'Twas full two years ere I could get a tooth. Grandam, this would have been a biting jest.
trg: I pray thee, pretty York, who told thee this?

src: Force her hence.
trg: Let him that makes but trifles of his eyes First hand me: on mine own accord I'll off; But first I'll do my errand. The good queen, For she is good, hath brought you forth a daughter; Here 'tis;

src: The worthy fellow is our general: he's the rock, the oak not to be wind-shaken.
trg: We will before the walls of Rome tomorrow Set down our host. My partner in this action, You must report to the Volscian lords, how plainly I have borne this business.

src: Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe, And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick? Why ask I that? my mangled body shows, My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.
trg: That I must yield my body to the earth And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.

src: Pray you, do. I'll know His pleasure; may be he will relent. Alas, He hath but as offended in a dream! All sects, all ages smack of this vice; and he To die for't!
trg: Now, what's the matter. Provost?

src: thou shalt think, Though he divide the realm and give thee half, It is too little, helping him to all;
trg: And he shall think that thou, which know'st the way To plant unrightful kings, wilt know again, Being ne'er so little urged, another way To pluck him headlong from the usurped throne.

src: I know it is the moon.
trg: Nay, then you lie: it is the blessed sun.

src: Perhaps, him and her, sir: what have you to do?
trg: Not her that chides, sir, at any hand, I pray.

src: a breath thou art, Servile to all the skyey influences, That dost this habitation, where thou keep'st, Hourly afflict: merely, thou art death's fool;
trg: For him thou labour'st by thy flight to shun And yet runn'st toward him still. Thou art not noble; For all the accommodations that thou bear'st Are nursed by baseness. Thou'rt by no means valiant;

src: He hath deserved worthily of his country:
trg: and his ascent is not by such easy degrees as those who, having been supple and courteous to the people, bonneted, without any further deed to have them at an into their estimation and report:

src: For thou are pleasant, gamesome, passing courteous, But slow in speech, yet sweet as spring-time flowers: Why does the world report that Kate doth limp? O slanderous world!
trg: Kate like the hazel-twig Is straight and slender and as brown in hue As hazel nuts and sweeter than the kernels. O, let me see thee walk: thou dost not halt.

src: yea, my gravity, Wherein--let no man hear me--I take pride, Could I with boot change for an idle plume, Which the air beats for vain.
trg: O place, O form, How often dost thou with thy case, thy habit, Wrench awe from fools and tie the wiser souls To thy false seeming! Blood, thou art blood: Let's write good angel on the devil's horn:

src: He did.
trg: And speaking it, he wistly look'd on me, And who should say, 'I would thou wert the man' That would divorce this terror from my heart;' Meaning the king at Pomfret. Come, let's go:

src: But sanctuary children ne'er till now.
trg: My lord, you shall o'er-rule my mind for once. Come on, Lord Hastings, will you go with me?

src: You say you do not know the lady's mind: Uneven is the course, I like it not.
trg: Immoderately she weeps for Tybalt's death, And therefore have I little talk'd of love; For Venus smiles not in a house of tears.

src: Come, bring them away: if these be good people in a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in common houses, I know no law: bring them away.
trg: How now, sir! What's your name? and what's the matter?

src: 'Tis very late, she'll not come down to-night: I promise you, but for your company, I would have been a-bed an hour ago.
trg: These times of woe afford no time to woo. Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.

src: If that be jest, then all the rest was so.
trg: Why, how now, dame! whence grows this insolence? Bianca, stand aside. Poor girl! she weeps. Go ply thy needle; meddle not with her.

src: Which way ran he that kill'd Mercutio? Tybalt, that murderer, which way ran he?
trg: There lies that Tybalt.

src: Ay, and the time seems thirty unto me, Being all this time abandon'd from your bed.
trg: 'Tis much. Servants, leave me and her alone. Madam, undress you and come now to bed.

src: Good queen, my lord, Good queen; I say good queen; And would by combat make her good, so were I A man, the worst about you.
trg: Force her hence.

src: Of an one pain, save for a night of groans Endured of her, for whom you bid like sorrow. Your children were vexation to your youth, But mine shall be a comfort to your age.
trg: The loss you have is but a son being king, And by that loss your daughter is made queen. I cannot make you what amends I would, Therefore accept such kindness as I can.

src: So fled his enemies my warlike father: Methinks, 'tis prize enough to be his son. See how the morning opes her golden gates, And takes her farewell of the glorious sun!
trg: How well resembles it the prime of youth, Trimm'd like a younker prancing to his love!

src: Even he, your wife, this lady, and myself, Are suitors to you.
trg: I beseech you, peace: Or, if you'ld ask, remember this before: The thing I have forsworn to grant may never Be held by you denials.

src: ' And thus still doing, thus he pass'd along.
trg: Alack, poor Richard! where rode he the whilst?

src: What with him? he comes not Like to his father's greatness: his approach, So out of circumstance and sudden, tells us 'Tis not a visitation framed, but forced By need and accident. What train?
trg: But few, And those but mean.

src: Happy, indeed, as we have spent the day. Brother, we done deeds of charity; Made peace enmity, fair love of hate, Between these swelling wrong-incensed peers.
trg: A blessed labour, my most sovereign liege: Amongst this princely heap, if any here, By false intelligence, or wrong surmise, Hold me a foe;

src: A mile before his tent fall down, and knee The way into his mercy: nay, if he coy'd To hear Cominius speak, I'll keep at home.
trg: He would not seem to know me.

src: Poor soul, thy face is much abused with tears.
trg: The tears have got small victory by that; For it was bad enough before their spite.

src: In truth, fair Montague, I am too fond, And therefore thou mayst think my 'havior light: But trust me, gentleman, I'll prove more true Than those that have more cunning to be strange.
trg: I should have been more strange, I must confess, But that thou overheard'st, ere I was ware, My true love's passion:

src: Not a resemblance, but a certainty.
trg: Yet since I see you fearful, that neither my coat, integrity, nor persuasion can with ease attempt you, I will go further than I meant, to pluck all fears out of you.

src: Why, then is my pump well flowered.
trg: Well said: follow me this jest now till thou hast worn out thy pump, that when the single sole of it is worn, the jest may remain after the wearing sole singular.

src: ' There is no end, no limit, measure, bound, In that word's death; no words can that woe sound. Where is my father, and my mother, nurse?
trg: Weeping and wailing over Tybalt's corse: Will you go to them? I will bring you thither.

src: Farewell, my wife, my mother: I'll do well yet. Thou old and true Menenius, Thy tears are salter than a younger man's, And venomous to thine eyes.
trg: My sometime general, I have seen thee stem, and thou hast oft beheld Heart-hardening spectacles; tell these sad women 'Tis fond to wail inevitable strokes, As 'tis to laugh at 'em.

src: Tut, tut, thou art all ice, thy kindness freezeth: Say, have I thy consent that they shall die?
trg: Give me some breath, some little pause, my lord Before I positively herein: I will resolve your grace immediately.

src: O holy friar, O, tell me, holy friar, Where is my lady's lord, where's Romeo?
trg: There on the ground, with his own tears made drunk.

src: You bid me make it orderly and well, According to the fashion and the time.
trg: Marry, and did; but if you be remember'd, I did not bid you mar it to the time. Go, hop me over every kennel home, For you shall hop without my custom, sir: I'll none of it: hence!

src: The fee-simple! O simple!
trg: By my head, here come the Capulets.

src: I prithee, good Grumio, tell me, how goes the world?
trg: A cold world, Curtis, in every office but thine; and therefore fire: do thy duty, and have thy duty; for my master and mistress are almost frozen to death.

src: Ay, and it makes men hate one another.
trg: Reason; because they then less need one another. The wars for my money. I hope to see Romans as cheap as Volscians. They are rising, they are rising.

src: Should I now meet my father, He would not call me son.
trg: Nay, you shall have no hat. Come, lady, come. Farewell, my friend.

src: No; if without more words you will get you hence.
trg: Why, sir, I pray, are not the streets as free For me as for you?

src: To express the like kindness, myself, that have been more kindly beholding to you than any, freely give unto you this young scholar, that hath been long studying at Rheims;
trg: as cunning in Greek, Latin, and other languages, as the other in music and mathematics: his name is Cambio; pray, accept his service.

src: God give your graces both A happy and a joyful time of day!
trg: As much to you, good sister! Whither away?
Villain, I'll make thee safe.

src: And so swear I, my lord
trg: Now, princely Buckingham, seal thou this league With thy embracements to my wife's allies, And make me happy in your unity.

src: It were no less; but yet I'll make a pause.
So please you, madam, To put apart these your attendants, I Shall bring Emilia forth.
trg: I pray now, call her. Withdraw yourselves.

src: Marry, bachelor, Her mother is the lady of the house, And a good lady, and a wise and virtuous I nursed her daughter, that you talk'd withal;
trg: I tell you, he that can lay hold of her Shall have the chinks.

src: Fairer than tongue can name thee, let me have Some patient leisure to excuse myself.
trg: Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst make No excuse current, but to hang thyself.

src: No? a dozen times at least.
trg: What, in metre?

src: Kind uncle York, the latest news we hear Is that the rebels have consumed with fire Our town of Cicester in Gloucestershire; But whether they be ta'en or slain we hear not.
trg: Welcome, my lord what is the news?

src: I bear no hatred, blessed man, for, lo, My intercession likewise steads my foe.
trg: Be plain, good son, and homely in thy drift; Riddling confession finds but riddling shrift.

src: Nicanor? no.
trg: The same, sir.

src: 'Thou shalt not steal'?
trg: Ay, that he razed.

src: my kingdom for a horse!
trg: God and your arms be praised, victorious friends, The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.

src: they looked as they had heard of a world ransomed, or one destroyed: a notable passion of wonder appeared in them;
trg: but the wisest beholder, that knew no more but seeing, could not say if the importance were joy or sorrow; but in the extremity of the one, it must needs be.

src: I'll buy him of you.
trg: No, I'll nor sell nor give him: lend you him I will For half a hundred years. Summon the town.

src: that Must bear my beating to his grave--shall join To thrust the lie unto him.
trg: Peace, both, and hear me speak.

src: Sir, I shall not be slack:
trg: in sign whereof, Please ye we may contrive this afternoon, And quaff carouses to our mistress' health, And do as adversaries do in law, Strive mightily, but eat and drink as friends.

src: In this point charge him home, that he affects Tyrannical power: if he evade us there, Enforce him with his envy to the people, And that the spoil got on the Antiates Was ne'er distributed.
trg: What, will he come?

src: in pure white robes, Like very sanctity, she did approach My cabin where I lay; thrice bow'd before me, And gasping to begin some speech, her eyes Became two spouts:
trg: the fury spent, anon Did this break-from her: and, for the babe Is counted lost for ever, Perdita, I prithee, call't.

src: All things is ready. How near is our master?
trg: E'en at hand, alighted by this; and therefore be not--Cock's passion, silence! I hear my master.

src: I know you can do very little alone; for your helps are many, or else your actions would grow wondrous single: your abilities are too infant-like for doing much alone. You talk of pride:
trg: O that you could turn your eyes toward the napes of your necks, and make but an interior survey of your good selves! O that you could!

src: Must I not serve a long apprenticehood To foreign passages, and in the end, Having my freedom, boast of nothing else But that I was a journeyman to grief?
trg: All places that the eye of heaven visits Are to a wise man ports and happy havens. Teach thy necessity to reason thus; There is no virtue like necessity.

src: we'll have thee to a couch Softer and sweeter than the lustful bed On purpose trimm'd up for Semiramis. Say thou wilt walk; we will bestrew the ground: Or wilt thou ride?
trg: thy horses shall be trapp'd, Their harness studded all with gold and pearl. Dost thou love hawking? thou hast hawks will soar Above the morning lark or wilt thou hunt?

src: Have I not in a pitched battle heard Loud 'larums, neighing steeds, and trumpets' clang?
trg: And do you tell me of a woman's tongue, That gives not half so great a blow to hear As will a chestnut in a farmer's fire? Tush, tush! fear boys with bugs.

src: Ha! fie, these filthy vices! It were as good To pardon him that hath from nature stolen A man already made, as to remit Their saucy sweetness that do coin heaven's image In stamps that are forbid:
trg: 'tis all as easy Falsely to take away a life true made As to put metal in restrained means To make a false one.

src: Trust me, my lord, all hitherto goes well; The common people by numbers swarm to us. But see where Somerset and Clarence come! Speak suddenly, my lords, are we all friends?
trg: Fear not that, my lord.

src: My noble uncle, do you know the cause?
trg: I neither know it nor can learn of him.

src: I have night's cloak to hide me from their sight; And but thou love me, let them find me here: My life were better ended by their hate, Than death prorogued, wanting of thy love.
trg: By whose direction found'st thou out this place?

src: Since birth, and heaven, and earth, all three do meet In thee at once; which thou at once wouldst lose. Fie, fie, thou shamest thy shape, thy love, thy wit;
trg: Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all, And usest none in that true use indeed Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:

src: Hark you, sir; you mean not her to--
trg: Perhaps, him and her, sir: what have you to do?

src: Richmond is on the seas.
trg: There let him sink, and be the seas on him! White-liver'd runagate, what doth he there?

src: Marry, I will; and this is wisely done.
trg: Ancient damnation! O most wicked fiend! Is it more sin to wish me thus forsworn, Or to dispraise my lord with that same tongue Which she hath praised him with above compare So many thousand times?

src: Well, well, thou hast a careful father, child; One who, to put thee from thy heaviness, Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy, That thou expect'st not nor I look'd not for.
trg: Madam, in happy time, what day is that?

src: O, give me pardon, That I, your vassal, have employ'd and pain'd Your unknown sovereignty!
trg: You are pardon'd, Isabel: And now, dear maid, be you as free to us. Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;

src: I hear their drums: let's set our men in order, And issue forth and bid them battle straight.
trg: Five men to twenty! though the odds be great, I doubt not, uncle, of our victory. Many a battle have I won in France, When as the enemy hath been ten to one:

src: Why uncle, thou hast many years to live.
trg: But not a minute, king, that thou canst give: Shorten my days thou canst with sullen sorrow, And pluck nights from me, but not lend a morrow;

src: From such a cause as fills mine eyes with tears And stops my tongue, while heart is drown'd in cares.
trg: Whate'er it be, be thou still like thyself, And sit thee by our side: Yield not thy neck To fortune's yoke, but let thy dauntless mind Still ride in triumph over all mischance.

src: Nay, but I know 'tis so: I saw him arrested, saw him carried away; and, which is more, within these three days his head to be chopped off.
trg: But, after all this fooling, I would not have it so. Art thou sure of this?

src: 'Tis time I should inform thee farther. Lend thy hand, And pluck my magic garment from me. So: Lie there, my art. Wipe thou thine eyes; have comfort. Sit down; For thou must now know farther.
trg: You have often Begun to tell me what I am, but stopp'd And left me to a bootless inquisition, Concluding 'Stay: not yet.'

src: Are they returned to the court?
trg: No: he so near to Hermione hath done Hermione that they say one would speak to her and stand in hope of answer: thither with all greediness of affection are they gone, and there they intend to sup.

src: It is not his, my lord; here Southam lies: The drum your honour hears marcheth from Warwick.
trg: Who should that be? belike, unlook'd-for friends.

src: And, in this rage, with some great kinsman's bone, As with a club, dash out my desperate brains? O, look!
trg: methinks I see my cousin's ghost Seeking out Romeo, that did spit his body Upon a rapier's point: stay, Tybalt, stay! Romeo, I come! this do I drink to thee.

src: Who, my master?
trg: Nay, it's no matter for that.

src: haply my presence May well abate the over-merry spleen Which otherwise would grow into extremes.
trg: For God's sake, a pot of small ale.

src: for if our virtues Did not go forth of us, 'twere all alike As if we had them not. But I do bend my speech To one that can my part in him advertise; Hold therefore, Angelo:
trg: -- In our remove be thou at full ourself; Mortality and mercy in Vienna Live in thy tongue and heart: old Escalus, Though first in question, is thy secondary. Take thy commission.

src: if powers divine Behold our human actions, as they do, I doubt not then but innocence shall make False accusation blush and tyranny Tremble at patience.
trg: You, my lord, best know, Who least will seem to do so, my past life Hath been as continent, as chaste, as true, As I am now unhappy;

src: Ay, to devour him; as the hungry plebeians would the noble Marcius.
trg: He's a lamb indeed, that baes like a bear.

src: If it were so,--
trg: What do ye talk? Have we not had a taste of his obedience? Our aediles smote? ourselves resisted? Come.

src: Unwieldy, slow, heavy and pale as lead. O God, she comes! O honey nurse, what news? Hast thou met with him? Send thy man away.
trg: Peter, stay at the gate.

src: These times of woe afford no time to woo. Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.
trg: I will, and know her mind early to-morrow; To-night she is mew'd up to her heaviness.

src: Royal commanders, be in readiness: For with a band of thirty thousand men Comes Warwick, backing of the Duke of York; And in the towns, as they do march along, Proclaims him king, and many fly to him:
trg: Darraign your battle, for they are at hand.

src: Yes, he would give't thee, from this rank offence, So to offend him still. This night's the time That I should do what I abhor to name, Or else thou diest to-morrow.
trg: Thou shalt not do't.

src: then, if angels fight, Weak men must fall, for heaven still guards the right. Welcome, my lord how far off lies your power?
trg: Nor near nor farther off, my gracious lord, Than this weak arm: discomfort guides my tongue And bids me speak of nothing but despair.

src: be't to fly, To swim, to dive into the fire, to ride On the curl'd clouds, to thy strong bidding task Ariel and all his quality.
trg: Hast thou, spirit, Perform'd to point the tempest that I bade thee?

src: our suit Is that you reconcile them: while the Volsces May say 'This mercy we have show'd;' the Romans, 'This we received;
trg: ' and each in either side Give the all-hail to thee and cry 'Be blest For making up this peace! Whose chronicle thus writ: 'The man was noble, But with his last attempt he wiped it out;

src: The queen is valued thirty thousand strong, And Somerset, with Oxford fled to her: If she have time to breathe be well assured Her faction will be full as strong as ours.
trg: We are advertised by our loving friends That they do hold their course toward Tewksbury: We, having now the best at Barnet field, Will thither straight, for willingness rids way;

src: Thou'rt a tall fellow: hold thee that to drink. Here comes Baptista: set your countenance, sir. Signior Baptista, you are happily met. Sir, this is the gentleman I told you of:
trg: I pray you stand good father to me now, Give me Bianca for my patrimony.

src: Face not me: thou hast braved many men; brave not me; I will neither be faced nor braved. I say unto thee, I bid thy master cut out the gown; but I did not bid him cut it to pieces: ergo, thou liest.
trg: Why, here is the note of the fashion to testify

src: What but to speak of would offend again.
trg: What, is't murder?

src: My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of; here with the provost.
trg: In very good time: speak not you to him till we call upon you.

src: And where the worser is predominant, Full soon the canker death eats up that plant.
trg: Good morrow, father.

src: Too well, too well thou tell'st a tale so ill. Where is the Earl of Wiltshire? where is Bagot? What is become of Bushy? where is Green?
trg: That they have let the dangerous enemy Measure our confines with such peaceful steps? If we prevail, their heads shall pay for it: I warrant they have made peace with Bolingbroke.

src: upon which errand I now go toward him; therefore follow me And mark what way I make: come, good my lord.
trg: Beseech you, sir, were you present at this relation?

src: Or, with the rest, where is your darling Rutland? Look, York: I stain'd this napkin with the blood That valiant Clifford, with his rapier's point, Made issue from the bosom of the boy;
trg: And if thine eyes can water for his death, I give thee this to dry thy cheeks withal. Alas poor York! but that I hate thee deadly, I should lament thy miserable state.

src: You scarcely have the hearts to tell me so, And therefore cannot have the hearts to do it. Wherein, my friends, have I offended you?
trg: Offended us you have not, but the king.

src: Didst perceive it? They're here with me already, whispering, rounding 'Sicilia is a so-forth:' 'tis far gone, When I shall gust it last. How came't, Camillo, That he did stay?
trg: At the good queen's entreaty.

src: He'ld sow't with nettle-seed.
trg: Or docks, or mallows.

src: You seem'd of late to make the law a tyrant; And rather proved the sliding of your brother A merriment than a vice.
trg: O, pardon me, my lord; it oft falls out, To have what we would have, we speak not what we mean: I something do excuse the thing I hate, For his advantage that I dearly love.

src: Norfolk, so far as to mine enemy:-- By this time, had the king permitted us, One of our souls had wander'd in the air.
trg: Banish'd this frail sepulchre of our flesh, As now our flesh is banish'd from this land: Confess thy treasons ere thou fly the realm;

src: And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so. Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace, With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!
trg: Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord, That would reduce these bloody days again, And make poor England weep in streams of blood!

src: For though it have holp madmen to their wits, In me it seems it will make wise men mad. Yet blessing on his heart that gives it me! For 'tis a sign of love;
trg: and love to Richard Is a strange brooch in this all-hating world.

src: Dare he presume to scorn us in this manner?
trg: I told your majesty as much before: This proveth Edward's love and Warwick's honesty.

src: Madam, your mother craves a word with you.
trg: What is her mother?

src: I shall, my lord.
trg: The gods begin to mock me. I, that now Refused most princely gifts, am bound to beg Of my lord general.

src: Good night, good night! as sweet repose and rest Come to thy heart as that within my breast!
trg: O, wilt thou leave me so unsatisfied?

src: Let him, my son: he shall not need to grieve At knowing of thy choice.
trg: Come, come, he must not. Mark our contract.

src: This man has marr'd his fortune.
trg: His nature is too noble for the world: He would not flatter Neptune for his trident, Or Jove for's power to thunder. His heart's his mouth: What his breast forges, that his tongue must vent;

src: Teach not thy lips such scorn, for they were made For kissing, lady, not for such contempt. If thy revengeful heart cannot forgive, Lo, here I lend thee this sharp-pointed sword;
trg: Which if thou please to hide in this true bosom. And let the soul forth that adoreth thee, I lay it naked to the deadly stroke, And humbly beg the death upon my knee. Nay, do not pause;

src: And that which spites me more than all these wants, He does it under name of perfect love; As who should say, if I should sleep or eat, 'Twere deadly sickness or else present death.
trg: I prithee go and get me some repast; I care not what, so it be wholesome food.

src: Such a fellow is not to be talked withal. Away with him to prison! Where is the provost? Away with him to prison! lay bolts enough upon him: let him speak no more.
trg: Away with those giglots too, and with the other confederate companion!

src: Temperance was a delicate wench.
trg: Ay, and a subtle; as he most learnedly delivered.

src: Tranio, you jest: but have you both forsworn me?
trg: Mistress, we have.

src: let them curtsy with their left legs and not presume to touch a hair of my master's horse-tail till they kiss their hands. Are they all ready?
trg: They are.

src: I would you had been by the ship side, to have helped her: there your charity would have lacked footing.
trg: Heavy matters! heavy matters! but look thee here, boy. Now bless thyself: thou mettest with things dying, I with things newborn. Here's a sight for thee;

src: Peace, children, peace! the king doth love you well: Incapable and shallow innocents, You cannot guess who caused your father's death.
trg: Grandam, we can; for my good uncle Gloucester Told me, the king, provoked by the queen, Devised impeachments to imprison him :

src: Petruchio, shall I then come roundly to thee And wish thee to a shrewd ill-favour'd wife? Thou'ldst thank me but a little for my counsel: And yet I'll promise thee she shall be rich And very rich:
trg: but thou'rt too much my friend, And I'll not wish thee to her.

src: He shall be endured: What, goodman boy! I say, he shall: go to; Am I the master here, or you? go to. You'll not endure him! God shall mend my soul! You'll make a mutiny among my guests!
trg: You will set cock-a-hoop! you'll be the man!

src: But my father hath made her mistress of the feast, and she lays it on. She hath made me four and twenty nose-gays for the shearers, three-man-song-men all, and very good ones;
trg: but they are most of them means and bases; but one puritan amongst them, and he sings psalms to horn-pipes. I must have saffron to colour the warden pies; mace; dates?--none, that's out of my note;

src: at some thing it grieves, More than with parting from my lord the king.
trg: Each substance of a grief hath twenty shadows, Which shows like grief itself, but is not so; For sorrow's eye, glazed with blinding tears, Divides one thing entire to many objects;

src: Be plain, Queen Margaret, and tell thy grief; It shall be eased, if France can yield relief.
trg: Those gracious words revive my drooping thoughts And give my tongue-tied sorrows leave to speak.

src: Banish us both and send the king with me.
trg: That were some love but little policy.

src: Do as thou list Thy valiantness was mine, thou suck'dst it from me, But owe thy pride thyself.
trg: Pray, be content: Mother, I am going to the market-place; Chide me no more. I'll mountebank their loves, Cog their hearts from them, and come home beloved Of all the trades in Rome. Look, I am going:

src: But to her love concerneth us to add Her father's liking: which to bring to pass, As I before unparted to your worship, I am to get a man,--whate'er he be, It skills not much.
trg: we'll fit him to our turn,-- And he shall be Vincentio of Pisa; And make assurance here in Padua Of greater sums than I have promised.

src: But Warwick's king is Edward's prisoner: And, gallant Warwick, do but answer this: What is the body when the head is off?
trg: Alas, that Warwick had no more forecast, But, whiles he thought to steal the single ten, The king was slily finger'd from the deck!

src: for I have made him know I have a servant comes with me along, That stays upon me, whose persuasion is I come about my brother.
trg: 'Tis well borne up. I have not yet made known to Mariana A word of this. What, ho! within! come forth! I pray you, be acquainted with this maid; She comes to do you good.

src: Who intercepts my expedition?
trg: O, she that might have intercepted thee, By strangling thee in her accursed womb From all the slaughters, wretch, that thou hast done!

src: 'Tis well borne up. I have not yet made known to Mariana A word of this. What, ho! within! come forth! I pray you, be acquainted with this maid; She comes to do you good.
trg: I do desire the like.

src: The law hath not been dead, though it hath slept: Those many had not dared to do that evil, If the first that did the edict infringe Had answer'd for his deed:
trg: now 'tis awake Takes note of what is done;

src: But in all places else your master Lucentio.
trg: Tranio, let's go: one thing more rests, that thyself execute, to make one among these wooers: if thou ask me why, sufficeth, my reasons are both good and weighty.

src: Heaven shield my mother play'd my father fair! For such a warped slip of wilderness Ne'er issued from his blood. Take my defiance! Die, perish!
trg: Might but my bending down Reprieve thee from thy fate, it should proceed: I'll pray a thousand prayers for thy death, No word to save thee.

src: And, in good time, here comes the noble duke.
trg: Good morrow to my sovereign king and queen: And, princely peers, a happy time of day!

src: Hold, then; go home, be merry, give consent To marry Paris: Wednesday is to-morrow: To-morrow night look that thou lie alone; Let not thy nurse lie with thee in thy chamber:
trg: Take thou this vial, being then in bed, And this distilled liquor drink thou off;

src: Your enemies and his find something in him.
trg: We are all undone, unless The noble man have mercy.

src: Thy father bears the type of King of Naples, Of both the Sicils and Jerusalem, Yet not so wealthy as an English yeoman. Hath that poor monarch taught thee to insult?
trg: It needs not, nor it boots thee not, proud queen, Unless the adage must be verified, That beggars mounted run their horse to death. 'Tis beauty that doth oft make women proud;

src: My business, sir, is to the king.
trg: What advocate hast thou to him?

src: Why, tell me, is not this my Cambio?
trg: Cambio is changed into Lucentio.

src: thou, having made me businesses which none without thee can sufficiently manage, must either stay to execute them thyself or take away with thee the very services thou hast done;
trg: which if I have not enough considered, as too much I cannot, to be more thankful to thee shall be my study, and my profit therein the heaping friendships.

src: Then she hath sworn that she will still live chaste?
trg: She hath, and in that sparing makes huge waste, For beauty starved with her severity Cuts beauty off from all posterity.

src: which friends, sir, as it were, durst not, look you, sir, show themselves, as we term it, his friends whilst he's in directitude.
trg: Directitude! what's that?

src: Why, thou say'st true; it is a paltry cap, A custard-coffin, a bauble, a silken pie: I love thee well, in that thou likest it not.
trg: Love me or love me not, I like the cap; And it I will have, or I will have none.

src: To the rock, to the rock with him!
trg: Peace! We need not put new matter to his charge:

src: I had thought, sir, to have held my peace until You have drawn oaths from him not to stay. You, sir, Charge him too coldly. Tell him, you are sure All in Bohemia's well;
trg: this satisfaction The by-gone day proclaim'd: say this to him, He's beat from his best ward.

src: In God's name and the king's, say who thou art And why thou comest thus knightly clad in arms, Against what man thou comest, and what thy quarrel: Speak truly, on thy knighthood and thy oath;
trg: As so defend thee heaven and thy valour!

src: Some one hath set you on: Confess the truth, and say by whose advice Thou camest here to complain.
trg: And is this all? Then, O you blessed ministers above, Keep me in patience, and with ripen'd time Unfold the evil which is here wrapt up In countenance!

src: My general cares not for you. Back, I say, go; lest I let forth your half-pint of blood; back,--that's the utmost of your having: back.
trg: Nay, but, fellow, fellow,--

src: What do ye talk? Have we not had a taste of his obedience? Our aediles smote? ourselves resisted? Come.
trg: Consider this: he has been bred i' the wars Since he could draw a sword, and is ill school'd In bolted language; meal and bran together He throws without distinction.

src: Ay, good brother, or go about to think.
trg: Lawn as white as driven snow; Cyprus black as e'er was crow; Gloves as sweet as damask roses; Masks for faces and for noses; Bugle bracelet, necklace amber, Perfume for a lady's chamber;

src: And tells us, what occasion of import Hath all so long detain'd you from your wife, And sent you hither so unlike yourself?
trg: Tedious it were to tell, and harsh to hear: Sufficeth I am come to keep my word, Though in some part enforced to digress;

src: A pleasing cordial, princely Buckingham, is this thy vow unto my sickly heart. There wanteth now our brother Gloucester here, To make the perfect period of this peace.
trg: And, in good time, here comes the noble duke.

src: Call forth Bagot. Now, Bagot, freely speak thy mind; What thou dost know of noble Gloucester's death, Who wrought it with the king, and who perform'd The bloody office of his timeless end.
trg: Then set before my face the Lord Aumerle.

src: You must not enter.
trg: Nay, rather, good my lords, be second to me: Fear you his tyrannous passion more, alas, Than the queen's life? a gracious innocent soul, More free than he is jealous.

src: At Pembroke, or at Harford-west, in Wales.
trg: What men of name resort to him?
I confess two sleeves.

src: O, let him marry her.
trg: This is the point. The duke is very strangely gone from hence; Bore many gentlemen, myself being one, In hand and hope of action:

src: Methinks I see him stamp thus, and call thus: 'Come on, you cowards! you were got in fear, Though you were born in Rome:
trg: ' his bloody brow With his mail'd hand then wiping, forth he goes, Like to a harvest-man that's task'd to mow Or all or lose his hire.

src: Nor I.
trg: Come, cousin, let us tell the queen these news.

src: Dost lack any money? I have a little money for thee.
trg: No, good sweet sir; no, I beseech you, sir: I have a kinsman not past three quarters of a mile hence, unto whom I was going; I shall there have money, or any thing I want:

src: Whither?
trg: Whither you will, so I were from your sights.

src: now here, At upper end o' the table, now i' the middle; On his shoulder, and his; her face o' fire With labour and the thing she took to quench it, She would to each one sip.
trg: You are retired, As if you were a feasted one and not The hostess of the meeting: pray you, bid These unknown friends to's welcome; for it is A way to make us better friends, more known.

src: Now, my lord, what shall we do, if we perceive Lord Hastings will not yield to our complots?
trg: Chop off his head, man; somewhat we will do: And, look, when I am king, claim thou of me The earldom of Hereford, and the moveables Whereof the king my brother stood possess'd.

src: Take thou some new infection to thy eye, And the rank poison of the old will die.
trg: Your plaintain-leaf is excellent for that.

src: Tut, tut, Thou troublest me; am not in the vein.
trg: Is it even so? rewards he my true service With such deep contempt made I him king for this? O, let me think on Hastings, and be gone To Brecknock, while my fearful head is on!

src: I am inform'd that he comes towards London, To set the crown once more on Henry's head: Guess thou the rest; There shall I rest secure from force and fraud.
trg: Come, therefore, let us fly while we may fly: If Warwick take us we are sure to die. 3 KING HENRY VI

src: Margaret.
trg: Richard!

src: You are sent for to the senate: A fearful army, led by Caius Marcius Associated with Aufidius, rages Upon our territories;
trg: and have already O'erborne their way, consumed with fire, and took What lay before them.

src: Be she honour-flaw'd, I have three daughters; the eldest is eleven The second and the third, nine, and some five; If this prove true, they'll pay for't: by mine honour, I'll geld 'em all;
trg: fourteen they shall not see, To bring false generations: they are co-heirs; And I had rather glib myself than they Should not produce fair issue.
Come, bring them away: if these be good people in a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in common houses, I know no law: bring them away.

src: I am bound to you: There is some sap in this.
trg: A cause more promising Than a wild dedication of yourselves To unpath'd waters, undream'd shores, most certain To miseries enough; no hope to help you, But as you shake off one to take another;

src: Help, help, help! here's a madman will murder me.
trg: Help, son! help, Signior Baptista!

src: Look, what I speak, my life shall prove it true;
trg: That Mowbray hath received eight thousand nobles In name of lendings for your highness' soldiers, The which he hath detain'd for lewd employments, Like a false traitor and injurious villain.

src: 'Zounds, he dies: I had forgot the reward.
trg: Where is thy conscience now?

src: Stand fast; We have as many friends as enemies.
trg: Sham it be put to that?

src: Here comes my son Aumerle.
trg: Aumerle that was; But that is lost for being Richard's friend, And, madam, you must call him Rutland now: I am in parliament pledge for his truth And lasting fealty to the new-made king.

src: Nay, women are frail too.
trg: Ay, as the glasses where they view themselves; Which are as easy broke as they make forms. Women! Help Heaven! men their creation mar In profiting by them. Nay, call us ten times frail;

src: Ay me! what news? why dost thou wring thy hands?
trg: Ah, well-a-day! he's dead, he's dead, he's dead! We are undone, lady, we are undone! Alack the day! he's gone, he's kill'd, he's dead!

src: The swifter speed the better.
trg: I understand the business, I hear it: to have an open ear, a quick eye, and a nimble hand, is necessary for a cut-purse; a good nose is requisite also, to smell out work for the other senses.

src: This child was prisoner to the womb and is By law and process of great nature thence Freed and enfranchised, not a party to The anger of the king nor guilty of, If any be, the trespass of the queen.
trg: I do believe it.

src: What are they that fly there?
trg: Richard and Hastings: let them go; here is The duke.

src: But since you come too late of our intents, Yet witness what you hear we did intend: And so, my good lord mayor, we bid farewell.
trg: Go, after, after, cousin Buckingham. The mayor towards Guildhall hies him in all post: There, at your meet'st advantage of the time, Infer the bastardy of Edward's children:

src: Dost thou not laugh?
trg: No, coz, I rather weep.

src: By this we gather You have tripp'd since.
trg: O my most sacred lady! Temptations have since then been born to's; for In those unfledged days was my wife a girl; Your precious self had then not cross'd the eyes Of my young play-fellow.

src: A sickness caught of me, and yet I well! I must be answer'd. how far off, how near; Which way to be prevented, if to be; If not, how best to bear it.
trg: Sir, I will tell you; Since I am charged in honour and by him That I think honourable:

src: I am going to visit the prisoner. Fare you well.
trg: Peace be with you! He who the sword of heaven will bear Should be as holy as severe; Pattern in himself to know, Grace to stand, and virtue go;

src: Yet,--
trg: He could not miss't.

src: My sovereign, with the loving citizens, Like to his island girt in with the ocean, Or modest Dian circled with her nymphs, Shall rest in London till we come to him.
trg: Fair lords, take leave and stand not to reply. Farewell, my sovereign.

src: Yet read the gamut of Hortensio.
Read it not, noble lords; But tell the traitor, in the high'st degree He hath abused your powers.
trg: Traitor! how now!

src: so, if he tell us his noble deeds, we must also tell him our noble acceptance of them. Ingratitude is monstrous, and for the multitude to be ingrateful, were to make a monster of the multitude:
trg: of the which we being members, should bring ourselves to be monstrous members.

src: But what's the matter, Clarence?  may I know?
trg: Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest As yet I do not: but, as I can learn, He hearkens after prophecies and dreams; And from the cross-row plucks the letter G.

src: We stay here for the people.
trg: Fare you well. He has it now, and by his looks methink 'Tis warm at 's heart.

src: Di faciant laudis summa sit ista tuae!
trg: Plantagenet! I come, Plantagenet! And this thy son's blood cleaving to my blade Shall rust upon my weapon, till thy blood, Congeal'd with this, do make me wipe off both. 3 KING HENRY VI

src: The wind sits fair for news to go to Ireland, But none returns. For us to levy power Proportionable to the enemy Is all unpossible.
trg: Besides, our nearness to the king in love Is near the hate of those love not the king.

src: Gladly, my lord.
trg: We have strict statutes and most biting laws. The needful bits and curbs to headstrong weeds, Which for this nineteen years we have let slip;

src: Whence are you, sir? Has the porter his eyes in his head; that he gives entrance to such companions? Pray, get you out.
trg: Away!

src: You are pardon'd, Isabel: And now, dear maid, be you as free to us. Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;
trg: And you may marvel why I obscured myself, Labouring to save his life, and would not rather Make rash remonstrance of my hidden power Than let him so be lost.

src: while I play the good husband at home, my son and my servant spend all at the university.
trg: How now! what's the matter?

src: In most uneven and distracted manner. His actions show much like to madness: pray heaven his wisdom be not tainted! And why meet him at the gates, and redeliver our authorities there
trg: I guess not.

src: By this at Daintry, with a puissant troop.
trg: Say, Somerville, what says my loving son? And, by thy guess, how nigh is Clarence now?

src: This is most likely!
trg: O, that it were as like as it is true!

src: Let me know the point.
trg: O, I do fear thee, Claudio; and I quake, Lest thou a feverous life shouldst entertain, And six or seven winters more respect Than a perpetual honour. Darest thou die?

src: No, by the holy rood, thou know'st it well, Thou camest on earth to make the earth my hell. A grievous burthen was thy birth to me; Tetchy and wayward was thy infancy;
trg: What comfortable hour canst thou name, That ever graced me in thy company?

src: And I could sing, would weeping do me good, And never borrow any tear of thee. But stay, here come the gardeners: Let's step into the shadow of these trees.
trg: My wretchedness unto a row of pins, They'll talk of state; for every one doth so Against a change; woe is forerun with woe.

src: Let me entreat you.
trg: It cannot be.

src: I am the king's friend, and will rid his foe.
trg: I have been studying how I may compare This prison where I live unto the world: And for because the world is populous And here is not a creature but myself, I cannot do it; yet I'll hammer it out.

src: My lord, your son was gone before I came.
trg: He was? Why, so! go all which way it will! The nobles they are fled, the commons they are cold, And will, I fear, revolt on Hereford's side. Sirrah, get thee to Plashy, to my sister Gloucester;

src: Ay, brother, to our grief, as it is yours: Too late he died that might have kept that title, Which by his death hath lost much majesty.
trg: How fares our cousin, noble Lord of York?

src: Look, sir.
trg: O,'tis Marcius! Let's fetch him off, or make remain alike.

src: what think you of it?
trg: If any in Vienna be of worth To undergo such ample grace and honour, It is Lord Angelo.

src: That in the captain's but a choleric word, Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.
beseech you all, my lords, With thoughts so qualified as your charities Shall best instruct you, measure me; and so The king's will be perform'd!
trg: Shall I be heard?

src: Ever right.
trg: Menenius ever, ever.

src: We will descend and fold him in our arms. Cousin of Hereford, as thy cause is right, So be thy fortune in this royal fight! Farewell, my blood;
trg: which if to-day thou shed, Lament we may, but not revenge thee dead.

src: Brother, give me thy hand; and, gentle Warwick, Let me embrace thee in my weary arms: I, that did never weep, now melt with woe That winter should cut off our spring-time so.
trg: Away, away! Once more, sweet lords farewell.

src: While we were interchanging thrusts and blows, Came more and more and fought on part and part, Till the prince came, who parted either part.
trg: O, where is Romeo? saw you him to-day? Right glad I am he was not at this fray.

src: How hast thou injured both thyself and us!
trg: I cannot stay to hear these articles.

src: So then you hope of pardon from Lord Angelo?
trg: The miserable have no other medicine But only hope: I've hope to live, and am prepared to die.

src: To speak so indirectly I am loath: I would say the truth; but to accuse him so, That is your part: yet I am advised to do it; He says, to veil full purpose.
trg: Be ruled by him.

src: Madam, I'll sing.
trg: 'Tis well that thou hast cause But thou shouldst please me better, wouldst thou weep.

src: One fairer than my love! the all-seeing sun Ne'er saw her match since first the world begun.
trg: Tut, you saw her fair, none else being by, Herself poised with herself in either eye:

src: Is Bushy, Green, and the Earl of Wiltshire dead?
trg: Ay, all of them at Bristol lost their heads.

src: Which I'll not call a creature of thy place, Lest barbarism, making me the precedent, Should a like language use to all degrees And mannerly distinguishment leave out Betwixt the prince and beggar:
trg: I have said She's an adulteress; I have said with whom:

src: And his well-chosen bride.
trg: I mind to tell him plainly what I think.

src: Villain, I'll make thee safe.
trg: Stay thy revengeful hand; thou hast no cause to fear.

src: You thus employ'd, I will go root away The noisome weeds, which without profit suck The soil's fertility from wholesome flowers.
trg: Hold thy peace: He that hath suffer'd this disorder'd spring Hath now himself met with the fall of leaf:

src: There might you have beheld one joy crown another, so and in such manner that it seemed sorrow wept to take leave of them, for their joy waded in tears.
trg: There was casting up of eyes, holding up of hands, with countenances of such distraction that they were to be known by garment, not by favour.

src: Renowned prince, how shall poor Henry live, Unless thou rescue him from foul despair?
trg: My quarrel and this English queen's are one.

src: Never came poison from so sweet a place.
trg: Never hung poison on a fouler toad. Out of my sight! thou dost infect my eyes.

src: Very well mended. Kiss him for that, good widow.
trg: 'He that is giddy thinks the world turns round:' I pray you, tell me what you meant by that.

src: In him there is a hope of government, That in his nonage council under him, And in his full and ripen'd years himself, No doubt, shall then and till then govern well.
trg: So stood the state when Henry the Sixth Was crown'd in Paris but at nine months old.

src: Stay, you that bear the corse, and set it down.
trg: What black magician conjures up this fiend, To stop devoted charitable deeds?

src: Look behind you, my lord.
trg: Take that, and that: if all this will not do, I'll drown you in the malmsey-butt within.

src: I am none, by this good light.
trg: Nor I, nor any But one that's here, and that's himself, for he The sacred honour of himself, his queen's, His hopeful son's, his babe's, betrays to slander, Whose sting is sharper than the sword's;

src: Neither, fair saint, if either thee dislike.
trg: How camest thou hither, tell me, and wherefore? The orchard walls are high and hard to climb, And the place death, considering who thou art, If any of my kinsmen find thee here.

src: The army of the queen hath got the field: My uncles both are slain in rescuing me;
trg: And all my followers to the eager foe Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves. My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:

src: Can I go forward when my heart is here? Turn back, dull earth, and find thy centre out.
trg: Romeo! my cousin Romeo!

src: He jests at scars that never felt a wound. But, soft! what light through yonder window breaks? It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.
trg: Arise, fair sun, and kill the envious moon, Who is already sick and pale with grief, That thou her maid art far more fair than she: Be not her maid, since she is envious;

src: Come, come.
trg: Soft! who comes here?

src: Nay, you shall have no hat. Come, lady, come. Farewell, my friend.
trg: Adieu, sir.

src: Yes; if there were no other excuse why they should desire to live.
trg: If the king had no son, they would desire to live on crutches till he had one.

src: come, good boy, the next way home.
trg: Go you the next way with your findings. I'll go see if the bear be gone from the gentleman and how much he hath eaten: they are never curst but when they are hungry:

src: No, good sweet sir; no, I beseech you, sir: I have a kinsman not past three quarters of a mile hence, unto whom I was going; I shall there have money, or any thing I want:
trg: offer me no money, I pray you; that kills my heart.

src: What is't o'clock?
trg: It's supper-time, my lord; It's nine o'clock.

src: How! dare not! do not. Do you know, and dare not? Be intelligent to me: 'tis thereabouts; For, to yourself, what you do know, you must. And cannot say, you dare not.
trg: Good Camillo, Your changed complexions are to me a mirror Which shows me mine changed too; for I must be A party in this alteration, finding Myself thus alter'd with 't.

src: Sir Christopher, tell Richmond this from me: That in the sty of this most bloody boar My son George Stanley is frank'd up in hold: If I revolt, off goes young George's head;
trg: The fear of that withholds my present aid. But, tell me, where is princely Richmond now?

src: We make woe wanton with this fond delay: Once more, adieu; the rest let sorrow say.
trg: My lord, you told me you would tell the rest, When weeping made you break the story off, of our two cousins coming into London.

src: Not knowing how to find the open air, But toiling desperately to find it out,-- Torment myself to catch the English crown:
trg: And from that torment I will free myself, Or hew my way out with a bloody axe.

src: An if I do not, may my hands rot off And never brandish more revengeful steel Over the glittering helmet of my foe!
trg: I task the earth to the like, forsworn Aumerle; And spur thee on with full as many lies As may be holloa'd in thy treacherous ear From sun to sun: there is my honour's pawn;

src: In that dead time when Gloucester's death was plotted, I heard you say, 'Is not my arm of length, That reacheth from the restful English court As far as Calais, to mine uncle's head?
trg: ' Amongst much other talk, that very time, I heard you say that you had rather refuse The offer of an hundred thousand crowns Than Bolingbroke's return to England;

src: Neighbour, well met: whither away so fast?
trg: I promise you, I scarcely know myself: Hear you the news abroad?

src: Good queen!
trg: Good queen, my lord, Good queen; I say good queen; And would by combat make her good, so were I A man, the worst about you.

src: That Edward is escaped from your brother, And fled, as he hears since, to Burgundy.
trg: Unsavoury news! but how made he escape?

src: Of much less value is my company Than your good words. But who comes here?
trg: It is my son, young Harry Percy, Sent from my brother Worcester, whencesoever. Harry, how fares your uncle?

src: Calmly, I do beseech you.
trg: Ay, as an ostler, that for the poorest piece Will bear the knave by the volume. The honour'd gods Keep Rome in safety, and the chairs of justice Supplied with worthy men! plant love among 's!

src: For him thou labour'st by thy flight to shun And yet runn'st toward him still. Thou art not noble; For all the accommodations that thou bear'st Are nursed by baseness. Thou'rt by no means valiant;
trg: For thou dost fear the soft and tender fork Of a poor worm. Thy best of rest is sleep, And that thou oft provokest; yet grossly fear'st Thy death, which is no more. Thou art not thyself;

src: Good Paulina, Who hast the memory of Hermione, I know, in honour, O, that ever I Had squared me to thy counsel!
trg: then, even now, I might have look'd upon my queen's full eyes, Have taken treasure from her lips--

src: Why, then mine honesty shall be my dower; For by that loss I will not purchase them.
trg: Therein thou wrong'st thy children mightily.

src: it has an elder sister, Or I mistake you: O, would her name were Grace! But once before I spoke to the purpose: when? Nay, let me have't; I long.
trg: Why, that was when Three crabbed months had sour'd themselves to death, Ere I could make thee open thy white hand And clap thyself my love: then didst thou utter 'I am yours for ever.'

src: What is the matter, my lord?
trg: Ho! who is within there? Saddle my horse. God for his mercy, what treachery is here!

src: Of love?
trg: Out of her favour, where I am in love.

src: Now, by my seat's right royal majesty, Wert thou not brother to great Edward's son, This tongue that runs so roundly in thy head Should run thy head from thy unreverent shoulders.
trg: O, spare me not, my brother Edward's son, For that I was his father Edward's son; That blood already, like the pelican, Hast thou tapp'd out and drunkenly caroused:

src: Beseech your highness, give us better credit: we all kneel.
trg: I am a feather for each wind that blows: Shall I live on to see this bastard kneel And call me father? better burn it now Than curse it then. But be it; let it live. It shall not neither.

src: Refuse not, mighty lord, this proffer'd love.
trg: O, make them joyful, grant their lawful suit!

src: Had he done so to great and growing men, They might have lived to bear and he to taste Their fruits of duty: superfluous branches We lop away, that bearing boughs may live:
trg: Had he done so, himself had borne the crown, Which waste of idle hours hath quite thrown down.

src: Meaning, to court'sy.
trg: Thou hast most kindly hit it.

src: Whence comest thou? what wouldst thou? thy name? Why speak'st not? speak, man: what's thy name?
trg: If, Tullus, Not yet thou knowest me, and, seeing me, dost not Think me for the man I am, necessity Commands me name myself.

src: And all my followers to the eager foe Turn back and fly, like ships before the wind Or lambs pursued by hunger-starved wolves. My sons, God knows what hath bechanced them:
trg: But this I know, they have demean'd themselves Like men born to renown by life or death. Three times did Richard make a lane to me. And thrice cried 'Courage, father! fight it out!

src: Of that fatal country, Sicilia, prithee speak no more; whose very naming punishes me with the remembrance of that penitent, as thou callest him, and reconciled king, my brother;
trg: whose loss of his most precious queen and children are even now to be afresh lamented. Say to me, when sawest thou the Prince Florizel, my son?

src: No: he so near to Hermione hath done Hermione that they say one would speak to her and stand in hope of answer: thither with all greediness of affection are they gone, and there they intend to sup.
trg: I thought she had some great matter there in hand; for she hath privately twice or thrice a day, ever since the death of Hermione, visited that removed house.

src: Thy tyranny Together working with thy jealousies, Fancies too weak for boys, too green and idle For girls of nine, O, think what they have done And then run mad indeed, stark mad!
trg: for all Thy by-gone fooleries were but spices of it. That thou betray'dst Polixenes,'twas nothing; That did but show thee, of a fool, inconstant And damnable ingrateful:

src: My pretty cousins, you mistake me much; I do lament the sickness of the king. As loath to lose him, not your father's death; It were lost sorrow to wail one that's lost.
trg: Then, grandam, you conclude that he is dead. The king my uncle is to blame for this: God will revenge it; whom I will importune With daily prayers all to that effect.

src: Which blood, like sacrificing Abel's, cries, Even from the tongueless caverns of the earth, To me for justice and rough chastisement;
trg: And, by the glorious worth of my descent, This arm shall do it, or this life be spent.

src: Ay, that's the first thing that we have to do; To free King Henry from imprisonment And see him seated in the regal throne. 3 KING HENRY VI
trg: Madam, what makes you in this sudden change?

src: And most chirurgeonly.
trg: It is foul weather in us all, good sir, When you are cloudy.

src: Thou art the cause, and most accursed effect.
trg: Your beauty was the cause of that effect; Your beauty: which did haunt me in my sleep To undertake the death of all the world, So I might live one hour in your sweet bosom.

src: 'Tis very true: thou didst it excellent. Well, you are come to me in a happy time; The rather for I have some sport in hand Wherein your cunning can assist me much.
trg: There is a lord will hear you play to-night: But I am doubtful of your modesties;

src: or else thou must be counted A servant grafted in my serious trust And therein negligent; or else a fool That seest a game play'd home, the rich stake drawn, And takest it all for jest.
trg: My gracious lord, I may be negligent, foolish and fearful; In every one of these no man is free, But that his negligence, his folly, fear, Among the infinite doings of the world, Sometime puts forth.

src: This your request Is altogether just: therefore bring forth, And in Apollos name, his oracle.
trg: The Emperor of Russia was my father: O that he were alive, and here beholding His daughter's trial! that he did but see The flatness of my misery, yet with eyes Of pity, not revenge!

src: I prate, And the most noble mother of the world Leave unsaluted: sink, my knee, i' the earth; Of thy deep duty more impression show Than that of common sons.
trg: O, stand up blest! Whilst, with no softer cushion than the flint, I kneel before thee; and unproperly Show duty, as mistaken all this while Between the child and parent.

src: Now, in good sadness, son Petruchio, I think thou hast the veriest shrew of all.
trg: Well, I say no: and therefore for assurance Let's each one send unto his wife; And he whose wife is most obedient To come at first when he doth send for her, Shall win the wager which we will propose.

src: I prithee go and get me some repast; I care not what, so it be wholesome food.
trg: What say you to a neat's foot?

src: Proof?
trg: Every true man's apparel fits your thief: if it be too little for your thief, your true man thinks it big enough; if it be too big for your thief, your thief thinks it little enough:

src: Hath he not pass'd the noble and the common?
trg: Cominius, no.

src: Is proclamation made, that who finds Edward Shall have a high reward, and he his life?
trg: It is: and lo, where youthful Edward comes!
